channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Sunday, December 8, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of free and low-cost Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family.
Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by the Queen Street Mall for pop-up entertainment and roaming performances.
For more information about Christmas in the heart of Brisbane, visit the Visit Brisbane website.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
Venue type: Light up asset, Park

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Sunday, December 8, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Human Rights Week
item.description:
Tuesday, December 10, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and Orange to support Human Rights Week.

Human Rights Week is an annual celebration which takes place every year to promote awareness and understanding of the importance of human rights. Human Rights Week begins on 1 December each year, culminating on Human Rights Day on 10 December.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Human Rights Commission.

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Thursday, December 12, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Monday, December 16, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Saturday, December 21, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Wednesday, December 25, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency
